Once upon a time, during WWII, somewhere in Nazi occupied Romania, a night
of comic misadventures ensues when a boy discovers a dead soldier. The German
authorities demand that the perpetrator must be identified or the town
leaders will be shot the following morning. In their desperation, led by
Father Johanis (Harvey Keitel), their salvation seems to lie in convincing the
town "fool", Ipu (GÃƒÂ©rard Depardieu), to agree to confess, and save them all
with his sacrifice. The comedy and darker sides of human nature race toward
the deadline where one cannot help but wonder who, in fact, is the actual
"fool"?
